WordPress membership plugins



WordPress membership plugins are a must when you build a website with gated content. They make it easier to encourage membership, edit permissions, and enable a smooth checkout experience. Here are the best options just for that.



1. Restrict Content Pro







Ratings: 3/5 ⭐️ with 65+ reviews and 10k+ installations



Restrict Content Pro allows you to monetize content access and easily structure membership content. It’s an optimal solution for big companies that want to create unlimited subscription levels and monitor how the programs are performing on a month-over-month basis. It’s definitely of the best free WordPress plugins for this purpose.



Pros




Excellent customer support



Many integrations including WooCommerce and other plugins



Highly detailed analytics and reporting




Cons




Limited in publicity options when compared with alternatives



Steep learning curve



Higher than average cost




Pricing




Free plan. Basic restrictions, features, and membership levels



One Site ($99/year). All free features plus 34 add-ons, plugin updates, private ticketed support, license for one site



Five Sites ($149/year). All the above plus license for 5 sites



Unlimited ($249/year). All the above plus license for unlimited sites





        



Technical requirements: WordPress Version 3.9 or higher
Demo
Download







2. Members







Ratings: 4.8/5 ⭐️ with 830+ reviews and 200,000+ installations 



Members (by Memberpress) is one of the largest membership plugins. It’s popular for its role editor feature and its overall simplicity. The plugin features the creation and editing of roles and customizable capacities. It comes with many integrations and explicit controls, so any user can customize the settings to exactly what they need. This customization is what sets it apart from other membership plugins.



Pros




You can give multiple roles to any user



You can input the specific approval or denial of each function to users under any role



Cloning feature available to copy an existing role for further editing



Simple to use, but highly customizable




Cons




Users complain of disruptive backend notifications



Free version is not comprehensive enough for most businesses



Occasional login technical issues




Pricing



A free version is available to try out before paying for a subscription.




Basic ($129/year). One site, unlimited members, payment integrations unlocked



Pro ($249/year). Two sites, advanced marketing integrations unlocked



Plus ($349/year). Up to five sites, premium support, selling corporate accounts





        
Technical requirements: WordPress Version 4.7 or higher
Download





3. S2Member







Ratings: 4/5 ⭐️ with 200+ reviews and 10,000+ installations



S2Member is a popular membership plugin with a free version available to all users. The free version is limited in features, but provides a decent starting point for startups. Premium version comes with more advanced features such as all applicable payment integrations, content dripping, and a few other key integrations.



Pros




Key integrations with MailChimp, bbPress, BuddyPress



Extensive knowledge base available to all users



Unlimited membership levels



PayPal, Stripe, Authorize.net integrations




Cons




Less user-friendly than the above alternatives



Subscription packages start at $89 per license



Free version only works with PayPal




Pricing




Framework (Free). Includes the plugin with PayPal integration plus basic customization



Pro ($89 one-time cost). All features unlocked



Pro Unlimited ($189 one-time cost). All features unlocked plus unlimited site license





        Technical requirements: WordPress Version 4.2 or higherDemoDownload




WordPress security plugins



Did you know that 41% of WordPress attacks are caused by the vulnerability of this hosting platform? WordPress security plugins solve this issue by protecting your site from malware attacks and keeping your data safe. Let’s go over a few plugins that excel in at least one specific area.



4. iThemes Security







Ratings: 4.6/5 ⭐️ with 3,896+ reviews and 1 million+ installations



One of the most used security plugins on the WordPress market, iThemes Security, focuses on threat detection and preventative measures. To do so, it secures your site and employs a range of checks to protect your WP login.



Pros




Modern authentication measures to protect your site’s integrity



Possibility to configure customizable permissions for clients and customers



Blocking and banning repeat cybersecurity offenders



Ongoing scanning and monitoring to root out suspicious activity




Cons




No firewall feature



May interact poorly with some hosting providers



Cannot prevent every conceivable attack




Pricing




One Site ($80/year). All features, one site



Ten Sites ($127/year). All features, up to ten sites



Unlimited Sites ($199/year). All features, unlimited sites





        Technical requirements: WordPress Version 5.8 or higherDownload




Read moreHave a look at our guide on how to use WordPress.



5. Jetpack







Ratings: 3.9/5 ⭐️ with 1,754+ reviews and 5+ million installations



Jetpack was designed by WordPress staff for more than just security—it offers image optimization, contact forms, and a tool to embed links and social media share buttons, just to name a few other features. But security is the most comprehensively covered category within the plugin. The additional design tools for your WordPress dashboard can be seen as a bonus. By default, Jetpack includes an automatic 24/7 security toolkit.



Pros




Host migration assistance 



Thorough, automatic protection from the most pressing security threats



Spam comments filters, submissions filters 



Brute attacks protection



Backs up your data automatically



Updates to keep up with cybersecurity developments




Cons




Interface may be seen as clunky and crowded



May slow down your site




Pricing



A free package is available that includes basic security measures. This free package isn’t recommended if you want meaningful protection.




Backup ($3.95/month). Real-time backup of your data, 30-day archive



Security ($8.95/month). Backup plus full scanning, 10k API calls/month antispam



Complete ($29.95/month). Security features plus 60k API calls/month antispam, 1 year archive





        Technical requirements: WordPress Version 5.8 or higherDownload




Read moreStill thinking if you made the right choice? Have a look at our list of the best WordPress alternatives.



6. SiteGround Security







Ratings: 4.6/5 ⭐️ with 53+ reviews and 400,000+ installations



SiteGround is a popular WordPress plugin that covers your site’s points of entry. Login access is where it starts, but this plugin provides surprisingly comprehensive coverage. For example, with the help of SiteGround, you can disable the XML-RPC protocol (optional) to hide any vulnerabilities from potential attackers. 



Pros




Extremely comprehensive and covers what most plugins miss



Positively affects site speed



24/7 customer support and active user forums



Free daily backup




Cons




Limited shared hosting



Low cost with promotion, but renewal is expensive



Cannot protect your site from thorough attacks




Pricing



Note that SiteGround entices new users with very low rates. However, if you renew after the first year, each rate will more than double.




StartUp ($2.99/month). One site, 10GB webspace



GrowBig ($6.69/month). Unlimited sites, but 20GB webspace, 30% faster PHP



GoGeek ($10.69/month). Unlimited sites, 40GB webspace, priority support, many smaller incentives





        Technical requirements: WordPress Version 4.7 or higher
Demo
Download




WordPress ecommerce add-ons



Ecommerce plugins are a must if you want to increase the efficiency of your online store. They offer features and functionalities that are meant to improve workflows and, ultimately, help you sell more. Let’s have a look at some of the best options.



7. WooCommerce







Ratings: 4.5/5 ⭐️ with 3,857+ reviews and 5+ million installations



Yes, we know that this must read like an obvious choice, but this list couldn’t be complete without WooCommerce. After all, 94% of all WP ecommerce websites use this plugin! It’s by far the most popular ecommerce plugin and for a good reason. WooCommerce is a complete solution that includes inventory and product management, shipping choices, unique customer profiles, loyalty rewards, and more. On top of that, it’s free.



If the base features don’t cut it for you, plenty of popular integrations can meet most businesses’ needs.



Pros




Complete solution for any ecommerce business



Numerous integrations with other industry leaders like HubSpot



Built-in high-quality security



Active community



Free to use the base product




Cons




Extras and integrations can become very expensive



Some users complain of sluggishness and shutdowns



Some alternatives are simpler and faster




Pricing



WordPress and WooCommerce are both free. However, many adjacent costs must be considered:




Hosting and domain



Plugins



Integrations



Management services



Shipping



Payment gateways



Security add-ons



SEO and other marketing tools





        Technical requirements: WordPress Version 5.7 or higherDemoDownload

The best extensions and plugins for WooCommerce



The best chatbot plugins for WooCommerce




8. Ecwid ecommerce shopping cart







Ratings: 4.5/5 ⭐️ with 213+ reviews and 30,000+ installations



Shopping carts come with the majority of ecommerce platforms. But not everyone wants to set up a whole new ecommerce infrastructure, especially if you sell on more places than just your WP store. Ecwid offers the option to set up a shopping cart on WordPress as well as on Instagram and Facebook. The plugin supports 175 countries speaking 45 languages with over 40 payment options.



Pros




Automatic shipping & taxes with base service



Social media selling (most popular ecommerce app on Facebook)



Mobile-friendly 



Unlimited storage and backups




Cons




Limited customer service with free plan



Limited SEO



Mobile POS integrations only work on iOS




Pricing




Free plan



Venture ($12.50/month). Unlocks mobile POS, store management



Business ($29.17/month). Unlocks wholesaling, eBay integration, phone support



Unlimited ($82.50/month). Unlocks full POS, Square integration, priority support





        Technical requirements: WordPress Version 4.4 or higherDemoDownload

10. Omnisend







Ratings: 4.6 with 800+ reviews and 30,000+ installations



Omnisend is a WordPress plugin for omnichannel marketing that’s a perfect match for online merchants, especially those using WooCommerce. This user-friendly platform provides a straightforward way to convert more and connect with your audience more effectively.



Omnisend makes it easy to automate, personalize and analyze marketing campaigns, allowing merchants to focus on what they do best: selling. Main features include: email, SMS, and web push notifications.



Pros




Very easy to use, even for beginners



Saves time by letting you manage all marketing channels in one place



Award-winning customer support available 24/7



Very generous free plan with access to all features & support




Cons




Only available in English

Quiz plugins for WordPress



Quiz plugins enable you to gain insights and get to the bottom of your clients’ needs and measure customer satisfaction. Here are our top picks to do this.



10. Quiz Cat







Ratings: 4.6/5 ⭐️ with 29+ reviews and 5,000+ installations 



Quiz Cat provides a fast and easy way to build quizzes. The plugin’s focus is on engagement and is meant for lead generation. But its aesthetic and prompts are also geared toward social media sharing.



Pros




Focused on customer engagement



Social media friendly and savvy



Easy to use HTML editor



Integrates with Gutenberg via shortcodes



Doesn’t slow your website down



Unlimited access




Cons




Relatively expensive for what you get



Only email support available



Basic package lacks analytics features




Pricing




Personal ($49). All basic quiz features



Business ($79). Up to three websites, analytics features unlocked



Elite ($149). Unlimited websites

Pros




Very professional appearance



Highly customizable



Includes surveys and other forms



Easy to use, with a drag-and-drop functionality

Lacking strong customer support

Ratings: 4.8/5 ⭐️ with 1,140+ reviews and 40,000+ installations



Quiz And Survey Master is a simple but highly customizable quiz plugin. It also focuses on user engagement, so you can encourage your website visitors to take the desirable action and keep them from leaving it.

Viral and trivia options available



Marketing tools included

Relatively limited applications

WordPress SEO plugins



Did you know that search engines drive 1000% more traffic than social media? No wonder why it’s crucial to invest in a good SEO strategy. WordPress SEO plugins can definitely help you with it. Here are the best options available on the wordpress.org repository.



13. Yoast SEO







Ratings: 4.8/5 ⭐️ with 27,464+ reviews and 5 million+ installations



Yoast SEO is one of the simplest and most popular SEO plugins on WordPress. With a quick download, you can instantly get prompts and suggestions for optimization. The result? Millions of clients praise this plugin for better visibility in the SERPs and increased traffic.



Pros




Easy to use



Includes all on-page SEO basics



Integrates with Elementor and Schema.org



Adds to easier sitemaps maintenance 



Improves loading times



Many tutorials available




Cons




Lacks features for the intent side of SEO



Suggestions are occasionally counterintuitive




Pricing




Yoast SEO Premium ($99/year). Better ongoing SEO monitoring, full access to educational library



Plugin Subscription ($229/year). All five Yoast plugins, includes SEO premium





        Technical requirements: WordPress Version 5.8 or higherDemoDownload




14. Rank Math







Ratings: 4.9/5 ⭐️ with 4,435+ reviews and 1 million+ installations



Rank Math calls itself “the Swiss Army knife of SEO” and it’s the first WordPress SEO plugin to use AI. The plugin’s “intelligent features” are at the core of what it offers. They are meant to enable one professional to do the work of a small team. The result is increased efficiency in the SEO goals of increased visibility and traffic.



Pros




Uses AI and smart features for greater efficiency



Suggestions for all SEO inputs (links, keywords, etc.)



Full role controls through roll manager interface



Painlessly integrates with the majority od page builder plugins




Cons




Very steep learning curve that requires existing SEO expertise



Some technical compatibility concerns with other WordPress plugins



Only premium plans get 24/7 support




Pricing




Free. No keyword tracking, limited schema generator, 5 AI content credits



Pro ($59/year). Unlimited websites but limited AI content creation credits



Business ($199/year). Support 200 client websites, track 20,000 keywords (instead of just 1,000)



Agency ($499/year). Track 75,000 keywords, 750 client websites, 750 AI content creation credits





        Technical requirements: WordPress Version 5.6 or higherDemoDownload




15. SEOPress







Ratings: 4.9/5 ⭐️ with 810+ reviews and 200,000+ installations



SEOPress is a plugin for SEO with an added focus on social sharing. In addition, it stands apart from similar plugins with its content analysis tools. The product is a strong SEO suite for WordPress users, especially individuals and small businesses. The result is a simpler and more guided path to increased organic traffic.



Pros




Easy import/export with Excel and Google Spreadsheets



Relatively inexpensive



Easy to use



Automatic image SEO features




Cons




Smaller support community compared to its bigger competitors like Yoast



Some customer support complaints




Pricing




SEOPress Pro ($49). Basic SEO suite for unlimited websites



SEOPress Insights ($99/site). For off-site SEO and all analytical tools



SEOPress Bundle ($128). The all-inclusive package but only one site per license





        Technical requirements: WordPress Version 4.7 or higherDemoDownload




WordPress booking plugins



The world has moved on and gone are the times when a client needs to make a phone call to book a hotel or even a visit to their favorite cosmetician. Now, these visits can be conveniently booked online and clients love it! In fact, 80% said that they would always choose an option to book online vs via phone. So, if you want to enable this option for your clients and increase customer loyalty, keep on reading—we’ve handpicked the best options.



16. Bookly







Ratings: 4.2/5 ⭐️ with 306+ reviews and 60,000+ installations 



Bookly is a free scheduling plugin. It enables online bookings and all the corresponding functionalities. The plugin is simple, with a reservation system, booking calendar, and email integrations. The product’s main benefits include saved time, a friendly UI, and minimal input requirements.



Pros




Base service is free



Very easy to use



Sound notifications



Option to change functionality within WYSIWYG editors



Choosing how the clients will book the visits in the front-end editor




Cons




Some users report technical difficulties



No warning for updates that may interrupt service




Pricing



Booking Activities is free to use. Users only pay for extensions and add-ons, all of which come with a 30-day money-back guarantee.




        Technical requirements: WordPress Version 3.7 or higherDemoDownload




17. Booking Activities







Ratings: 4.9/5 ⭐️ with 88+ reviews and 4,000+ installations 



Booking Activities is a booking plugin designed for professional service delivery. All the normal booking functionalities are included. Then, features are designed to make it easier to sell subscriptions, seminars, or events that span several days. This makes it ideal for consultants taking care of trainings, demos, and webinars.



Pros




Simple drag-and-drop functionality



Designed for multiday events



WooCommerce integration



WYSIWYG editors for planning




Cons




Free version lacks some key features



Must pay to feature calendar on your site




Pricing



Booking Activities is free by default, but the plugin charges users for uses of premium features. If you want to use an add-on or premium feature, you pay per use.




        Technical requirements: WordPress Version 3.6 or higherDemoDownload




18. Salon Booking System







Ratings: 4.4/5 ⭐️ with 151+ reviews and 8,000+ installations



The Salon Booking System plugin is a complete scheduling tool for small businesses. The plugin’s creators specify that it’s meant for hairdressers, barbers, beauty salons, spas, mechanical workshops, therapists, tutors, and healthcare testing centers. This focus makes the plugin highly useful for businesses in this market segment.



Pros




Designed for specific business types



Excellent customer support



Functions in Czech, Dutch, French, and Swedish



Email and SMS followup




Cons




Clunkiness may sometimes slow down or crash site



Multisite functionality is limited



Some customers complain about bugs




Pricing




Basic (€59/year). One install



Business (€89/year). Two installs, georeferencing, multishop functionality



Full Support (€149/year. Two on-site installs and setups with priority support 





        Technical requirements: WordPress Version 4.1 or higherDemoDownload




WordPress donation plugins



Donation plugins are meant to safely and transparently enable donations for your website visitors and customers. They are perfect for non-profit organizations or fundraising. Here are our top picks for this category.
